intro: Belantheria, commonly known as the fairy bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of only one species, Belantheria americana, which is native to eastern North America. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Belantheria is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy blooms in the spring and early summer.
